page.title: 13St. Nicholas' Cottesmore
page.content: The church in the village is over 800 years old.The Tower is about 700 years old.As you walk into the church you go through a Norman door way with zig-zags round it.Above you is the parvise which was used by the vicar or monks to see who was coming to worship or to attack.The pulpit was made of wood when King James was on the throne.The round arches you can see are Norman,the pointed ones are Early English.There are six bells and they were put up in 1660.The R.A.F. chapel was designed by Sir Giles Gilbert Scott and has a crest on the back window.There is a screen here made by a blacksmith from Whissendine called Mr.Wiggington.Hanging here are flags from nations whose people served at R.A.F.Cottesmore during World War Two.
